segments.text: Peeking into this kitchen, I see the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's holding a plate, towel in hand, looking serene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Suddenly, I realize the water's overflowing from the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's cascading down the front, pooling on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is wet, and she might slip any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: To her left, a boy's on a stool, hand in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool wobbles dangerously; he could topple backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching up, part of this risky game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If the stool tips on the wet floor, it'll be awful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're sneaking cookies, but the danger overshadows the fun.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a calm garden, unaware of the tension inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hold my breath, hoping no one gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This ordinary day feels so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Please, let everything turn out okay.
segments.speaker: PAR
